poem:
Title: A Brexit Sketch

On the parapets of commerce,
Trade talks crumble, phones duel,
A duel of figures and inflation,
Whispers of a financial tumble.

US numbers casting shadows,
Interest rates dancing in March's arms,
Spring's early chill,
Carries economists' alarm.

Yet, in the country's marrow,
In the falconer's grip, the falcon hovers,
As I, a Welsh poet, watch in silence,
The dance of global lovers.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UK ditches post-Brexit Canada trade talks; Vodafone and Three UK merger under investigation – business live 3.02pm GMT US inflation data 'keeps alive' prospect of Federal Reserve rate cut - closing summary US inflation data did not deliver a huge surprise on Friday, but the trajectory appeared to be enough to set up a Federal Reserve interest rate cut in March, several economists and investors argued. Charles Hepworth, investment director at GAM Investments, said: The". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: UK ditches post-Brexit Canada trade talks; Vodafone and Three UK merger under investigation – business live 3.02pm GMT US inflation data 'keeps alive' prospect of Federal Reserve rate cut - closing summary US inflation data did not deliver a huge surprise on Friday, but the trajectory appeared to be enough to set up a Federal Reserve interest rate cut in March, several economists and investors argued. Charles Hepworth, investment director at GAM Investments, said: The
